Due to the recommendation released by the University Interscholastic League (UIL) on Wednesday, July 1st, San Angelo ISD is temporarily suspending all athletic workouts and practices until Monday, July 13th. This includes all athletics, strength and conditioning, band, and color guard.

“For schools in areas experiencing community spread of COVID-19, this temporary suspension will reduce risk of exposure and provide an opportunity to review current plans and re-evaluate local context in order to make informed decisions moving forward,’ the UIL said in a statement.

“UIL will continue to work with state officials and monitor CDC and other federal guidance to determine any potential modifications to UIL summer guidelines.’

Continue to check the San Angelo ISD website and social media pages for updates.

Virtual Learning Tip #1: Creating a supportive space for learning at home is essential for student success! Here are some things to consider:

* A good writing and device space, like a desk or a table with a comfortable chair – a bed is not a good working space.
* Plenty of good light – like a table lamp or natural lighting from open windows.
* Minimize distractions as best as you can – create blocks of quiet time.
* Plan the week on Monday with progress checks every evening and plan forward for the next day.
* Create a daily checklist of assignments to help your child be accountable.
* Set an alarm to wake up and start the day.
* Eat breakfast and schedule breaks for lunch.
* Schedule family time and plenty of breaks in between lessons.

Make the most of each day! Happy learning!
